revised_title: Anatomical Study of Corpora Pedunculata in Sphinx Ligustri and Other Lepidoptera
tldr: The author examines the corpora pedunculata, or mushroom bodies, in the brains of Sphinx Ligustri and other Lepidoptera species. They describe the structure and function of the calyx, stalk, and roots of the mushroom bodies, as well as the various neuron types and their connections within the brain. The study provides insights into the organization and complexity of the insect nervous system.
